level.heading: THE CONTRACTING OFFICER’S RESPONSIBILITY FOR CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION (§7-4623)

level.text: The Contracting Officer has overall responsibility for the contract’s administration. Among other things, this requires the Contracting Officer:
To monitor whether goods or services are delivered or completed on schedule and conform to contract requirements;
To ensure that any contractually required inspection or acceptance procedures are followed;
To monitor the contractor’s compliance with any subcontracting requirements contained in the contract; and
To identify and attempt to resolve issues or problems that arise during contract performance.
The Contracting Officer has the authority to take the following actions:
Prior to terminating a contract, the Contracting Officer shall first obtain the approval of the CCO.
No representative of the Hospital, including a Contracting Officer, shall:
Act in a manner that misleads a contractor regarding the limits of his or her authority; or
Direct or encourage a contractor to perform work that has not been properly authorized.

Source: Notice of Emergency and Proposed Rulemaking published at 57 DCR 8507 (October 8, 2010)[EXPIRED]; as amended by Notice of Emergency and Proposed Rulemaking published at 58 DCR 3086 (April 18, 2011)[EXPIRED]; as amended by Notice of Final Rulemaking published at 58 DCR 4565, 4590 (May 27, 2011).
